meanings.definition: Instructed or improved intellectually or morally.
meanings.sent1: The edified students showed great understanding of the topic.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's edified approach helped the students learn effectively.
meanings.sent3: The edified class was full of eager learners.
meanings.sent4: Her edified mind was a beacon of knowledge in the community.
meanings.sent5: The edified lesson left a lasting impact on the students.

meanings.sent1: The edified structure stood tall against the wind.
meanings.sent2: The edified walls of the castle were a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent3: The edified tower seemed to reach the sky.
meanings.sent4: His edified creation was a masterpiece of architecture.
meanings.sent5: The edified building was a marvel of engineering.

meanings.sent1: The edified team felt motivated to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent2: Her edified spirit inspired those around her.
meanings.sent3: The edified atmosphere lifted everyone's mood.
meanings.sent4: His edified words gave hope to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The edified community supported each other through tough times.
